title: Haverhill Rovers remove supporters from stadium due to abuse
body_text:
The chairman of a non-league football club has reiterated their zero-tolerance approach to abuse after supporters had to be removed from their stadium due to comments made towards the female opposition manager.
The Suffolk FA is investigating the alleged incident, which took place at the game between Haverhill Rovers and Stanway Pegasus in the Thurlow Nunn First Division North on Saturday.
Two supporters were removed from the The New Croft following comments made towards Stanway manager Rosi Webb, one of the highest-ranking women managers in the men's game.
Ryan Churcher, chairman of Haverhill Rovers, said the individuals will not welcomed back at the west Suffolk football club.
He said: "We don't accept it. I was told about the incident and the two supporters involved were asked to leave the ground and won't be coming back.
"Our stance is we don't accept that. At the football club we have got numerous female teams. We are actively searching for a women's senior side at the minute."
Mr Churcher said the football club will take any punishment they are given.
He also thanked the individual who reported the incident to club staff.
"We have a zero tolerance approach. We 100% want to support the women's game," added Mr Churcher.
A spokesperson for Suffolk FA said it is aware of the incident.
"We are aware of the alleged incident at the Haverhill Rovers versus Stanway Pegasus match on Saturday," the FA said.
“We have received a match report regarding the alleged incident during the fixture and will conduct an investigation.”
Haverhill Rovers won the game 2-0 to maintain their presence at the top of the league table.
Stanway Pegasus were approached for comment.
